description: Borrowed from Latin prōsecūtus, perfect participle of prōsequor. Doublet of pursue, from Old French. Compare also persecute.

verbs.description: prosecute (third-person singular simple present prosecutes, present participle prosecuting, simple past and past participle prosecuted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, law) To start criminal proceedings against.
examples: to prosecute a man for trespass, or for a riot

entries.meaning: To seek to obtain by legal process.
examples: to prosecute a right or a claim in a court of law

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pursue something to the end.
examples: to prosecute a scheme, hope, or claim
